meanings.definition: A person who tends cattle on a ranch
meanings.sent1: The cowhand fed the cattle every morning.
meanings.sent2: The rancher hired a new cowhand to help with the cattle.
meanings.sent3: The cowhand tried to ride a cow like a horse, but it didn't work out.
meanings.sent4: The cowhand's dedication to caring for the cattle was as strong as a sturdy fence.
meanings.sent5: The sunburnt cowhand whistled as he herded the cattle across the field.

meanings.definition: To work as a cowhand on a ranch
meanings.sent1: She decided to cowhand for the summer to earn some extra money.
meanings.sent2: He cowhands on weekends to experience ranch life.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to cowhand, roping imaginary cattle in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The way he cowhands through challenges shows his determination.
meanings.sent5: Cowhanding under the hot sun can be exhausting but rewarding work.
